definitions.definition: To extend the term of a patent beyond the normal legal limit, usually through repeated small modifications.
To set the repayment rate of a loan at or below the interest rate, so low that the principal will never be repaid.

main_definition: ( patent law , pharmaceuticals ) To extend the term of a patent beyond the normal legal limit, usually through repeated small modifications.
secondary_definitions: ( banking ) To set the repayment rate of a loan at or below the interest rate, so low that the principal will never be repaid.
